newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ratos sets price for Scandic hotel sale.
newsitem.headline: Ratos sets price for Scandic hotel sale.

text.p: Swedish property group Ratos said it fixed the sale price of its Scandic hotel chain at between 80 and 95 crowns per share.
The Swedish bourse prospectus will be published on November 25.
Ratos is selling between 9.55 million and 11.25 million of its 17 million shares in Scandic Hotels, and seeking a separate listing for the hotel group.
Ratos said Enskilda Securities and Dresdner Kleinwort Benson, the two lead banks, had an option to acquire a further 1.5 million shares from Ratos.
Depending on the success of the sale, Ratos will hold between 5.95 million shares or 35 percent and 4.25 million or 25 percent of the share capital of Scandic after the divestment.
